about_the_game:
A COMPACT MAP FOR SMALL GAME HUNTING
Located in Schleswig-Holstein, which sits near the border of northern Germany and Denmark, Salzwiesen Park offers a more contained biome packed with the same animal density and species diversity as a standard reserve. Equipped with a shotgun or your favorite weapon of choice, enjoy the thrill of hunting within these smaller-scale wetlands, making your way through reed beds and summer polder to seek out the park’s large bird population as well as the mammals that have adapted well to this flooded environment.


KEY FEATURES:
  • Explore a beautiful compact park designed specifically for memorable small game hunting experiences.
  • New Clay Shooting Range – Train your aim and test your skills on your own or against friends in clay- and skeet-shooting.
  • Hunt 15 small game and waterfowl species, including two new birds—the Ferruginous Duck and Gadwall.
  • The GOPI 10G GRAND Shotgun – Perfect for targeting small game and waterfowl, the new over-under shotgun is a versatile addition to your arsenal and also great for the shooting range.

FULL SPECIES LIST:
Birds:
Gadwall
Ferruginous Duck
Black Grouse
Ring-Necked Pheasant
Mallard
Eurasian Teal
Tufted Duck
Golden Eye
Eurasian Wigeon
Bean Goose
Greylag Goose

Small Game:
Red Fox
European Rabbit
Common Raccoon
Raccoon Dog
